meanings.definition: A person who plays with another person.
meanings.sent1: My little sister and I are happy playfellows.
meanings.sent2: During recess, the children ran around the playground with their playfellows.
meanings.sent3: The two puppies were the best playfellows, always chasing each other around.
meanings.sent4: In the world of imagination, books can be our playfellows, taking us on exciting adventures.
meanings.sent5: The playground was filled with laughter as the playfellows enjoyed their games together.

meanings.sent1: The loyal dog was the boy's faithful playfellow.
meanings.sent2: At the park, the children found a new playfellow to join their game.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten made a great playfellow for the little girl, always pouncing on her toys.
meanings.sent4: Imagination can be a wonderful playfellow, creating endless possibilities for fun.
meanings.sent5: The toy robot became the boy's favorite playfellow, always ready for an adventure.
